intro: Craterostigma latibracteatum, commonly known as the broad bract rockcress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. The species is native to parts of Asia and is often found in mountainous regions where it thrives in well-drained soils.
